Experience

Being in a cooperative educational university program, I have the opportunity to be in the workforce every other four months. I love to take on new innovating opportunities to apply my skills in a professional environment and develop myself as an engineer. Here are my past coop positions as well as other experience I have been able to take part in.

Process Engineer Co-op Student - BWXT

  • In my first co-op I collected data to assist in a $140-million contract nuclear project
  • This massive nuclear project involved shifting off balanced fuel channels back into place in Bruce Power's Unit 3 nuclear reactor
  • The software we used to collect data was made in excel and I had the opportunity to help develop it using VBA
  • Extensive preparation and data analysis was needed before fuel channel shifting to ensure everything ran optimally (Each minute the data helped save, Bruce Power got back $2000 for the reactor being powered back on)

January 2021 - April 2021

Hyperloop Motor Developer - Waterloop

  • To keep myself busy when I have some spare time, I am currently on a university design team that is designing and constructing a hyperloop that will revolutionize the future of transportation
  • My role on this team is to help develop the linear induction motor (LIM) used to propel and levitate the hyperloop pod
  • I help test the properties of multiple linear induction motor designs using actual prototypes we develop and a software called COMSOL Multiphysics
  • We use SolidWorks to model the motors and other required devices
  • The overall hyperloop our team designs is put to the test in annual SpaceX competitions

January 2021 - Present

Swimming Instructor - Town of Milton

  • While studying in high school I worked part time as a swimming instructor
  • Each shift I taught 8 classes either with 5 to 10 students or 1 student who required special assistance
  • After teaching the classes 10 times, I wrote personalized report cards for each student using the spreadsheets I created for each class
  • I was also required to publicize safety standards to everyone in and around the pool and be ready to support in any injuries/accidents that could occur

August 2018 - March 2020

Karate Assistant Instructor - Fighting Griffin

  • During my 13 year long journey to obtain my black belt in Gōjū-ryū karate, I had the opportunity to help the higher ranked black belts teach classes
  • I taught classes of 25 students and helped develop their karate techniques
  • Whenever possible, I taught students individually to improve specific areas that needed extra help
  • Additionally, I helped organize and run club wide events such as parties, summer camps, and karate tournaments

October 2016 - March 2020
